nodes.bodyText: can remove this
Parser should use newline token(s) only to make parsing-decisions. It should not use these tokens when creating nodes. Newlines should come from the minutiae as before.

Let's discuss here,
#26429 (comment)
Remove commented out codes in all places
Let's create an issue to track these disabled tests
Can call this AbstractTomlParserTest

nodes.bodyText:
Resource files hierarchy doesn't seems to be consistent.
Shall we go as:
src/test/resources/
    |_ syntax
        |_tables
        |   |_source1.bal
        |   |_source2.bal
        |   |_assert1.bal
        |   |_assert2.bal
        |   |_<both positive and negative tests goes here. Can be distinguish by adding a suffix (say 'negative') to the file name>
        |_keyValue

nodes.bodyText:
Need to handle the carriage return properly.
We should emit only one newline token regardless whether it is \n or \r\n
Should be okay now.
We could do this without this additional flag.

Here its good to check whether the next character is a newline

If so, send the newline token.
Otherwise, go back to the default mode and send a normal token.

I've done the same thing before submitting PR. It did not make any difference when I tested with different inputs as we are only starting the mode when processing newline. but yeah having the check is good for maintainability. I'll add it back.
Newline is a single word. Lets update in all places.
Should be a single word NEWLINE

nodes.bodyText: Shall we define System.lineSeparator() as a constant and use that?
